content.description:
Start in the left side of the crack off the ground, and use large holds to gain the ledge. From here, enjoy the filthy chimney! You can use a combination of face holds on the outside and squeezing up the inside to progress upward and gain the anchor. Its dirty in there, but trust me, it used to be much worse. Bring a broom!

There are two crack systems running from the ground to the top of pika palace. This climb starts in the right one, which itself has two branches from the ground.
Bolted top anchor, with rap ring. 5 bolts on the way up.

The first 10 feet of this climb are some of the hardest. Off the ground try your best to use the offwidth crack and face features to make your way up. When the cracks join, move out onto the face. There are good opposing side pulls for your right and left hands, followed by a good jug up high. The rest of the climb to the top gets a bit thin.

This climb is immediately to the right of Cradle of Filth. You can rig it by climbing Cradle of Filth and traversing over. 
4 bolts, rap anchor

steep arete line. Shinny anchors up top

On the arete.
bolts

Crux is getting the second bolt. From there there are lots of sharp shitty holds that suck all the way to the top. Tends to be dirty as well, which is no fun.

First bolted climb on the giant flake thing.
3 bolts and then top anchors.

It's a fun arete climb that can also be climbed on the face (harder and skinny, 5.10b). Move through a bulge to the face with under clings and good feet. Past the bolt up to the arete with decent feet on the face. Move up to the corner and look for good hands at the left side of the block. With good feet, reach up to jugs and pull your way to the top.

Far left edge of Pika's Palace
4 bolts, rap rings

Climb the crack feature, to blocky terrain mid way.
Chains on the upper face have some awesome moves on the arete and face, or finish on easy terrain out right.
This was, and still can be a trad route, but now there are bolts for sport enthusiasts. 

Around the corner from Trash Pump, at the big crack system.
4 bolts and top anchors.

climbs.name: Trash Pump (It Ate My Finger Fucker)

content.description:
Crimpy and pumpy awesomeness. Crank through the first half to attain a rightward crack system. Trends really far right, compared to the bolts. Very awkward... Would be a better climb had the bolts been placed better.

Further right on the detached giant flake.
5 bolts and top anchors.

Crux is 2nd to 3rd bolt up. 
 Using the crack way out right would make this significantly easier. 
 Climb up just left of the crack using tiny rails. After first or second bolt, head left on tiny side pulls. Clip the third bolt, then get your right hand out far right on a tiny side-pull, then on a farther better side-pull. Place better feet, then left hand on really bad side-pull. Then up on rails that get progressively better until it's super easy.

At the very end of the giant flake thing.
5 bolts? Plus top anchors.
